context: The Estonian word 'siiamaani' is an adverbial expression meaning 'so far', 'up to now', or 'until now'. It indicates the time period extending from some point in the past up to the present moment. This word is commonly used to refer to events, situations, or states that have occurred or existed until the current time. In Estonian grammar, it functions as an adverb of time and is often placed at the end of sentences or clauses where it modifies the temporal aspect of the verb.
